thread.title: KGO-TV shuffles anchors; Cheryl Jennings, Kristen Sze, Eric Thomas involved in moves
thread.title_full: KGO-TV shuffles anchors; Cheryl Jennings, Kristen Sze, Eric Thomas involved in moves

author:
Chuck Barney

cbarney@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: KGO-TV shuffles anchors; Cheryl Jennings, Kristen Sze, Eric Thomas involved in moves
text:
KGO-TV shuffles anchors; Cheryl Jennings, Kristen Sze, Eric Thomas involved in moves By Chuck Barney Posted: 10/07/2015 03:25:00 PM PDT Updated: 10/07/2015 04:14:01 PM PDT They appear to be playing musical anchor chairs at KGO (ABC 7) in San Francisco, where the TV station has made several significant personnel changes in recent days. 
Kristen Sze and Eric Thomas are reportedly being moved off the morning desk to be replaced by recent hires Natasha Zouves and Reggie Aqui. 
Those moves are in addition to the one made last week involving 36-year KGO veteran anchor Cheryl Jennings. She announced that she would be leaving the 5 and 11 p.m. anchor desk to devote her time to "long-form in-depth stories" and continue her duties as host of KGO's public affairs show, "Beyond the Headlines." ABC 7 News anchors Cheryl Jennings, right, and Don Sanchez in the tent at the Ronald McDonald House cocktail reception on March 22, 2014. (Janet Duca Norton) 
Jennings told her followers on Facebook that she's "really excited by this new opportunity" and that it was her decision to leave the anchor desk. Some, however, have speculated that management may have nudged her in that direction. 
Just last year, Carolyn Johnson, one of KGO's most high-profile anchors, left the station after telling this publication that she was asked to take a pay cut amid budgetary trimming at KGO. Johnson had two years left on her contract but opted to move to a station in Southern California. 
The Sze and Thomas moves were first reported by Bay Area media blogger Rich Lieberman. The two anchors had been a fixture on KGO's morning telecast for at least 15 years. Advertisement 
Sze will become the 11 a.m. and 5 p.m. co-anchor when Jennings moves into her new role later this year. Thomas will move to weekend anchor and reporter. 
Zouves came from San Diego's KGTV in July. Aqui recently left Portland's KGW to work at KGO. 
KGO is owned and operated by ABC. A station spokesperson was not immediately available for comment. Contact Chuck Barney at Facebook.com/BayAreaNewsGroup.ChuckBarney , or Twitter.com/chuckbarney .
